diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Hereditary Leiomyomatosis and Renal Cell Carcinoma (HLRCC) Syndrome combined with Adrenocortical Carcinoma (ACC)
differential_diagnosis: Metastatic renal cancer to the adrenal gland
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of HLRCC syndrome combined with ACC was made based on the patient's young age, family history of renal cell cancer, presence of bulky uterine leiomyomas, and findings from imaging studies including MRI revealing characteristics consistent with ACC. Pathologic analysis post-surgery confirmed ACC and high-grade papillary renal cell carcinoma.
